result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorne James Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge, waiving all other court costs in this matter.  
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) The Clerk of Courts may collect on these financial obligations via prison income assignment.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.

Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. 

Burnett County case 22CF104 was DRI.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorne James Jackson

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 called together.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Lorne James Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Otten: def pleading to Ct 1 poss meth in 22CF58; joint rec for time-served (134 days); remaining counts to be DRI.  Court asks State to provide basis for the agreement.  State assures VR compliance.  State provides basis for agreement.  Atty Otten supplements basis.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 of 22CF58- Possession of methamphetamine and orders a JOC; remaining counts and case are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: 
6 months jail, 134 days jail credit.  
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life. Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. $250 DNA surcharge only, payment may be taken from prison wage assignment.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

9:59 AM Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Lorne James Jackson. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: agreement reached, needs plea/sentencing date, recites agreement- def to plead to Possession of methamphetamine in 22CF58, remaining counts to be DRI; joint rec for time-served sentence.  State adds- def getting revoked due to these charges, will be going back to prison.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:39 AM Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Lorne James Jackson. Def appears from Burnett County Jail.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: Drug Court contemplated, working on details of an agreement.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:00 AM Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Lorne James Jackson. Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def facing revocation, which impacts this case, requesting additional STC.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:18 AM Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 called together. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Lorne James Jackson. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: State reconsidering Drug Court, will need time to meet and discuss.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:13 AM Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 called together.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF58 set for arraignment.  Case 22CF104 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Sergeant Cliff Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Otten crosses.  State objects- relevance, beyond the scope; sustained.  No redirect, State asks for bindover.  Atty Otten argues.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint.  Atty Otten preserves on motions until next Status, will proceed to arraignment today.  Cases 22CF58 and 22CF104 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.  If resolution reached prior to date, atty to reset with JA.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on May 4, 2022 at 11:15 am.

02:34 PM Called 22CF58 scheduled for PH and 22CF104 for INIT.  Defendant Lorne James Jackson in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant in custody with Burnett Co Jail.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.  Case 22CF58 is on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information, which mirrors the criminal complaint.  Will schedule out ARGN.  Case 22CF104 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights, waive further reading.  NG plea entered on misdemeanors.  Cash bond set, bond will continue.  Attny will schedule with JA to keep within time limits.

No contact with the victims or their residence.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered to misdeanors.  WTLPH.  Bond continues.  Def must appear in person for next hearing (prelim).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
